meanings.sent1: She always misclassifies the documents, causing confusion.
meanings.sent2: It is easy to misclassify items when you are in a hurry.
meanings.sent3: The robot misclassified the fruits as vegetables and created chaos in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to misclassify people's intentions often leads to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The detective's misclassification of the evidence almost led to the wrong conclusion.

meanings.definition: The act of assigning something to the wrong category or group.
meanings.sent1: The misclassification of the books made it hard to find the right one.
meanings.sent2: There was a misclassification of the products in the inventory system.
meanings.sent3: The misclassification of the animals in the zoo led to a hilarious mix-up during feeding time.
meanings.sent4: The misclassification of the stars in the sky confused the amateur astronomer.
meanings.sent5: The misclassification of the plants in the garden caused a beautiful but unexpected arrangement.
